traits.name: Analytical Parsing
traits.description: Breaks problems into discrete components for systematic analysis

traits.name: Holistic Sensing
traits.description: Perceives situations as unified wholes rather than component parts

traits.name: Bottom-Up Processing
traits.description: Builds understanding from specific details to general patterns

traits.name: Top-Down Processing
traits.description: Applies general frameworks to interpret specific situations

traits.name: Rule-First Reasoning
traits.description: Seeks general principles before making decisions

traits.name: Exception-First Reasoning
traits.description: Considers unique circumstances before applying general rules

traits.name: Literal Interpretation
traits.description: Takes communication at face value

traits.name: Implied Meaning Detection
traits.description: Reads between the lines for unstated intentions

traits.name: Precision Seeking
traits.description: Values exact specifications and clear boundaries

traits.name: Approximation Tolerant
traits.description: Comfortable with rough estimates and fuzzy categories

traits.name: Model Building
traits.description: Creates abstract frameworks to understand phenomena

traits.name: Example Driven
traits.description: Learns through concrete instances and case studies

traits.name: Future Projection
traits.description: Focuses on long-term outcomes and distant goals

traits.name: Present Situational
traits.description: Attends to immediate circumstances and current state

traits.name: Long Horizon
traits.description: Plans across extended timeframes

traits.name: Short Cycle
traits.description: Works in quick iterations with frequent adjustments

traits.name: Deadline Driven
traits.description: Activated by time pressure and fixed endpoints

traits.name: Steady Pace
traits.description: Maintains consistent effort independent of deadlines

traits.name: Sequence Dependent
traits.description: Follows predetermined step-by-step plans

traits.name: Opportunistic Planning
traits.description: Adapts plans based on emerging opportunities

traits.name: Pre-Commitment
traits.description: Makes advance decisions to constrain future choices

traits.name: Optionality Preservation
traits.description: Keeps multiple options open as long as possible

traits.name: Reward Seeking
traits.description: Motivated by potential gains and positive outcomes

traits.name: Loss Avoidance
traits.description: Motivated by preventing negative outcomes

traits.name: Intrinsic Goals
traits.description: Pursues activities for inherent satisfaction

traits.name: External Prompts
traits.description: Responds to environmental cues and social expectations

traits.name: Challenge Seeking
traits.description: Drawn to difficult problems and growth opportunities

traits.name: Stability Seeking
traits.description: Values predictability and established routines

traits.name: Completion Oriented
traits.description: Focuses on finishing tasks and achieving closure

traits.name: Exploration Oriented
traits.description: Prioritizes discovering new possibilities over finishing

traits.name: Initiates Interaction
traits.description: Proactively starts social exchanges

traits.name: Responds to Interaction
traits.description: Engages when others initiate contact

traits.name: Explicit Verbalization
traits.description: States intentions and expectations directly

traits.name: Context-Dependent Communication
traits.description: Relies on shared understanding and implicit signals

traits.name: Boundary Asserting
traits.description: Clearly states personal limits and needs

traits.name: Boundary Probing
traits.description: Tests implicit social boundaries through interaction

traits.name: Confrontation Tolerant
traits.description: Comfortable with direct disagreement and conflict

traits.name: Confrontation Averse
traits.description: Avoids direct conflict and seeks harmony

traits.name: Emotion First
traits.description: Emotional reactions precede cognitive processing

traits.name: Emotion Post-Processed
traits.description: Cognitive analysis precedes emotional experience

traits.name: Affect Driven
traits.description: Decisions heavily influenced by emotional state

traits.name: Affect Filtered
traits.description: Separates emotional reactions from decision logic

traits.name: Rapid Emotional Labeling
traits.description: Quickly identifies and names emotional states

traits.name: Delayed Emotional Recognition
traits.description: Takes time to identify what they're feeling

traits.name: Ambiguity Tolerant
traits.description: Comfortable with unclear situations and incomplete information

traits.name: Ambiguity Intolerant
traits.description: Seeks clarity and complete information before proceeding

traits.name: Control Seeking
traits.description: Maintains direct oversight of important outcomes

traits.name: Trust Delegating
traits.description: Comfortable relying on others for critical tasks

traits.name: Risk Sampling
traits.description: Takes calculated risks to gather information

traits.name: Risk Filtering
traits.description: Avoids uncertain situations until more data available

traits.name: Redundancy Building
traits.description: Creates backup plans and safety margins

traits.name: Single Path
traits.description: Commits to one approach and optimizes it

traits.name: Iteration First
traits.description: Starts with quick attempts and refines through feedback

traits.name: Specification First
traits.description: Plans comprehensively before taking action

traits.name: Self-Interruptible
traits.description: Easily shifts between tasks as needs arise

traits.name: Focus Lock
traits.description: Maintains deep concentration on single task

traits.name: Task Batching
traits.description: Groups similar activities for efficiency

traits.name: Task Streaming
traits.description: Handles items individually as they arrive

traits.name: Optimization Seeking
traits.description: Continuously improves processes for maximum efficiency

traits.name: Sufficiency Seeking
traits.description: Stops when solution meets requirements

traits.name: Principle Driven
traits.description: Adheres to core values regardless of outcomes

traits.name: Outcome Driven
traits.description: Adjusts approach based on results

traits.name: Belief Stability
traits.description: Maintains consistent views over time

traits.name: Belief Plasticity
traits.description: Updates beliefs readily with new information

traits.name: Authority Skeptical
traits.description: Questions conventional wisdom and expert claims

traits.name: Authority Anchored
traits.description: Trusts established expertise and credentials

vignettes.question: You're trying to fix something that's broken. Which approach feels most natural?

options.label: A
options.text: Carefully examine it to understand what went wrong

options.label: B
options.text: Try different solutions and see what works

options.label: C
options.text: Look up instructions or ask someone who knows

vignettes.question: When someone says 'let's do this sometime,' you typically...

options.label: A
options.text: Assume they mean it and expect to make concrete plans

options.label: B
options.text: Recognize it as friendly talk, not a real commitment

options.label: C
options.text: Wait to see if they bring it up again

vignettes.question: When making an important decision, you naturally rely most on...

options.label: A
options.text: Logical analysis of pros and cons

options.label: B
options.text: Your gut feeling about what's right

options.label: C
options.text: Practical outcomes and what actually works

vignettes.question: You have free time with no plans. You're most likely to...

options.label: A
options.text: Do whatever feels appealing in the moment

options.label: B
options.text: Work on something productive you've been meaning to do

options.label: C
options.text: Enjoy the unstructured time without forcing activity

vignettes.question: Someone criticizes you unexpectedly. Your first internal response is...

options.label: A
options.text: An emotional reaction - hurt, defensive, or upset

options.label: B
options.text: Evaluating whether their criticism is valid

options.label: C
options.text: Wanting to understand exactly what they mean

vignettes.question: Starting a complex project, you feel ready when...

options.label: A
options.text: You have a clear plan and know the major steps

options.label: B
options.text: You understand the goal and can start figuring it out

options.label: C
options.text: The deadline makes it urgent to begin

vignettes.question: Your team disagrees on the best approach. You tend to...

options.label: A
options.text: Trust the most experienced person's judgment

options.label: B
options.text: Evaluate each option on its own merits

options.label: C
options.text: Look for a compromise everyone can accept

vignettes.question: Learning new software, you prefer to...

options.label: A
options.text: Follow a tutorial or examples

options.label: B
options.text: Read about how the system works overall

options.label: C
options.text: Explore and experiment to figure it out

vignettes.question: A friend seems upset but says they're fine. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Take their words at face value

options.label: B
options.text: Gently check in to see if they want to talk

options.label: C
options.text: Let them know you're available if needed

vignettes.question: Halfway through a task, you realize a better approach. You typically...

options.label: A
options.text: Switch to the better method right away

options.label: B
options.text: Finish the current approach first

options.label: C
options.text: Weigh if the improvement is worth restarting

vignettes.question: Invited to an event where you won't know anyone. Your gut reaction is...

options.label: A
options.text: Interested - could be fun to meet new people

options.label: B
options.text: Cautious - want more details before deciding

options.label: C
options.text: Hesitant - prefer events where you know people

vignettes.question: You notice something that might become a problem later. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Address it now to prevent future issues

options.label: B
options.text: Deal with it if and when it actually becomes a problem

options.label: C
options.text: Keep an eye on it but don't act prematurely

vignettes.question: You need to decide but don't have all the information. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Wait until you can get more information

options.label: B
options.text: Make your best judgment with what you have

options.label: C
options.text: Consult someone else or get their input

vignettes.question: Everyone in a group agrees on something you think is wrong. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Voice your disagreement openly

options.label: B
options.text: Go along with the group decision

options.label: C
options.text: Raise it privately with someone afterward

vignettes.question: In a presentation, something isn't clear to you. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Ask questions to clarify

options.label: B
options.text: Look it up or figure it out on your own later

options.label: C
options.text: Assume it'll become clear as they continue

vignettes.question: You have multiple unrelated tasks today. You tend to...

options.label: A
options.text: Plan an efficient order to complete them all

options.label: B
options.text: Handle them flexibly as opportunities arise

options.label: C
options.text: Do the most urgent or important ones first

vignettes.question: You realize you've been wrong about something. Your typical response is...

options.label: A
options.text: Frustrated with yourself for the mistake

options.label: B
options.text: Curious about why you had it wrong

options.label: C
options.text: Glad to know the correct information now

vignettes.question: Someone suggests a different way to do something you're working on. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Consider their suggestion seriously

options.label: B
options.text: Stick with your approach that works

options.label: C
options.text: Try it to see if it's actually better

vignettes.question: You've made something that works but isn't perfect. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Keep refining it until it's really good

options.label: B
options.text: Move on - it does what it needs to

options.label: C
options.text: Decide based on how important it is

vignettes.question: At a networking event where you know nobody, you naturally...

options.label: A
options.text: Introduce yourself and start conversations

options.label: B
options.text: Join conversations when there's an opening

options.label: C
options.text: Observe and stay toward the periphery

vignettes.question: You have a strong opinion but others disagree. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Argue your position with reasoning

options.label: B
options.text: Listen and reconsider your view

options.label: C
options.text: Keep your opinion but avoid arguing

vignettes.question: You want to learn something new. You typically...

options.label: A
options.text: Study the fundamentals and theory first

options.label: B
options.text: Jump in and learn by doing

options.label: C
options.text: Find someone knowledgeable to teach you

vignettes.question: A task is taking much longer than expected. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Push harder to meet the original timeline

options.label: B
options.text: Adjust your timeline realistically

options.label: C
options.text: Feel stressed about the delay

vignettes.question: Teaching someone something complex, you naturally...

options.label: A
options.text: Walk through specific examples step-by-step

options.label: B
options.text: Explain the overall concept first, then details

options.label: C
options.text: Use analogies to things they already know

vignettes.question: Working on multiple projects simultaneously, you feel...

options.label: A
options.text: Energized by the variety

options.label: B
options.text: Scattered and unable to focus properly

options.label: C
options.text: Fine with proper organization

vignettes.question: You're focused on work when someone needs your help. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Help them immediately

options.label: B
options.text: Let them know when you'll be available

options.label: C
options.text: Assess urgency before deciding

vignettes.question: You make a visible mistake in front of others. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Feel embarrassed and self-conscious

options.label: B
options.text: Focus on fixing it quickly

options.label: C
options.text: Laugh it off and move on

vignettes.question: Choosing between a safe certain option and a risky uncertain one, you focus on...

options.label: A
options.text: What you could lose

options.label: B
options.text: What you could gain

options.label: C
options.text: How much control you have over the outcome

vignettes.question: Your usual routine gets disrupted unexpectedly. You feel...

options.label: A
options.text: Uncomfortable and thrown off

options.label: B
options.text: Fine - you adapt easily to changes

options.label: C
options.text: Interested by the unexpected change

vignettes.question: You encounter information that contradicts your beliefs. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Look for problems with the information

options.label: B
options.text: Seriously consider that you might be wrong

options.label: C
options.text: Seek out additional sources to clarify

vignettes.question: You finish something ahead of schedule. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Start the next task right away

options.label: B
options.text: Take a break to recharge

options.label: C
options.text: Review and improve what you just finished

vignettes.question: Given an assignment with minimal direction, you...

options.label: A
options.text: Ask for specific requirements upfront

options.label: B
options.text: Use your judgment and check in as you go

options.label: C
options.text: Create a plan and get approval before starting

vignettes.question: When explaining complex ideas, you naturally...

options.label: A
options.text: Use analogies and real-world examples

options.label: B
options.text: Build from first principles step-by-step

options.label: C
options.text: Start with the big picture then fill in details

vignettes.question: You're working on something and hit an unexpected obstacle. Your immediate reaction:

options.label: A
options.text: Feel frustrated but push through

options.label: B
options.text: Step back to reassess the approach

options.label: C
options.text: Try a few quick workarounds

vignettes.question: In group discussions, you tend to...

options.label: A
options.text: Share ideas as they come to you

options.label: B
options.text: Think through your points before speaking

options.label: C
options.text: Listen mostly, speak when you have something important

vignettes.question: When you receive vague instructions, you...

options.label: A
options.text: Immediately ask clarifying questions

options.label: B
options.text: Fill in the gaps with reasonable assumptions

options.label: C
options.text: Start working and clarify as issues arise

vignettes.question: Facing a tight deadline with incomplete work, you prioritize...

options.label: A
options.text: Getting something complete even if imperfect

options.label: B
options.text: Finishing the most important parts well

options.label: C
options.text: Negotiating for more time

vignettes.question: You overhear people discussing a topic you know well but getting wrong. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Jump in to correct the misinformation

options.label: B
options.text: Let it go unless it really matters

options.label: C
options.text: Offer a correction if appropriate to the situation

vignettes.question: When learning a new skill, you feel most effective when...

options.label: A
options.text: Someone shows you how it's done

options.label: B
options.text: You understand the underlying principles

options.label: C
options.text: You can experiment and practice

vignettes.question: Someone questions your competence publicly. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Defend yourself with evidence

options.label: B
options.text: Address it privately later

options.label: C
options.text: Let your work speak for itself

vignettes.question: You discover your approach won't work and need to start over. You feel...

options.label: A
options.text: Defeated and frustrated

options.label: B
options.text: Annoyed but ready to try again

options.label: C
options.text: Curious what will work better

vignettes.question: In a crisis situation, you instinctively...

options.label: A
options.text: Take charge and direct action

options.label: B
options.text: Stay calm and assess the situation

options.label: C
options.text: Support whoever is leading

vignettes.question: When brainstorming, you prefer to...

options.label: A
options.text: Generate many ideas quickly without judging

options.label: B
options.text: Think through feasible solutions carefully

options.label: C
options.text: Build on others' ideas

vignettes.question: A project's scope keeps expanding beyond original plans. You...

options.label: A
options.text: Push back to maintain boundaries

options.label: B
options.text: Adapt and incorporate new requirements

options.label: C
options.text: Renegotiate timeline or resources
